comments.content:
Can't find a match. It's close to [Avenir](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317072746/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/avenir) with main differences on /G and /M. Also, could be my eyes but a bit confused by the kerning on 'CHROMEO' which looks kind of weird/amateurish/absent (which could be the earmark of a freebie). Letter width looks also unconsistent, /H and /M looking weird among the others... A way to answer could be to [buy last issue](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317072746/http:/pocketmags.com/viewmagazine.aspx?titleid=2086&title=Be+Street) and inspect PDF type properties...  
Some alternatives: [Europa](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317072746/http:/www.europatype.com/articledetail/17), [Nevis](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317072746/http:/www.tenbytwenty.com/nevis.php), [Circe](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317072746/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/paratype/circe), [Hurme Geometric Sans 4](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317072746/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/hurme-design/hurme-geometric-sans-4)

I actually did buy it, but the website apparently uses an online reader, so downloading the PDF isn't an option. I agree, it's a very schizofrenic typeface, but I really need it for a school assignment. Anyone else have any suggestions? I'm desperate.
After looking through your suggestions again, I think Hurme may be close enough to pass. Thank you!
